Two tornadoes touch down in Louisiana, bringing 90 MPH winds
19 minutes ago
The National Weather Service confirmed EF-0 and EF-1 tornadoes hit St. James and Ascension parishes Tuesday, bringing winds up to 90 mph.

author: Redacción Digital
title: Extienden Estado de Emergencia por Cambio Climático en Panamá | Radio Mayabeque
text: Panamá: El Gobierno de Panamá amplió la declaratoria de Estado de Emergencia Ambiental en todo el país por la sequía prolongada causada por la crisis climática. En tal sentido, la ampliación será hasta el 31 de mayo de 2024, dicha declaratoria tenía vigencia hasta este 31 de diciembre. En tal sentido, desde la Presidencia de Panamá, en un consejo de gabinete, se tomó la decisión tomando como base los pronósticos climáticos que señalaron que la sequía se puede prolongar hasta mediados del próximo año. El ministro de Ambiente de Panamá, Milciades Concepción, explicó que la nueva declaratoria fue sustentada en las altas temperaturas registradas, faltas de lluvia por el Fenómeno de El Niño, afectando los lagos Alajuela y Gatún, el Canal de Panamá, así como la producción agropecuaria La resolución original data del 30 de mayo pasado, de acuerdo con la información divulgada por el Palacio de las Garzas (sede de Gobierno de Panamá) en un comunicado. El Ministerio de Desarrollo Agropecuario, el Ministerio de Salud, el Instituto de Acueducto y Alcantarillados Nacionales, el Ministerio de Ambiente, la Autoridad Nacional de Servicios Públicos y el Instituto de Meteorología e Hidrología de Panamá, son las entidades autorizadas para realizar las contrataciones especiales necesarias en este Estado, según la resolución aprobada. Como punto final, la resolución establece que la misma puede ser modificada por el consejo de Gabinete para realizar contrataciones especiales o ampliar el periodo en el cual dichas contrataciones pueden realizarse.

author: @portalmvd
title: Paraguay exige a EE.UU. retirar a su embajador por sanción a tabacalera vinculada a Cartes
text: El Gobierno de Paraguay pidió a Estados Unidos que se retire de su país el embajador en Asunción, Marc Ostfield, luego de las declaraciones que dio tras las sanciones anunciadas por la Oficina de Control de Activos Extranjeros del Departamento del Tesoro a una tabacalera paraguaya por haber dado apoyo financiero al expresidente Horacio Cartes (2013-2018). El exmandatario y líder del oficialista Partido Colorado figura desde enero de 2023 en la lista de personas corruptas elaborada desde esa oficina en Washington, por lo que sus activos y empresas fueron bloqueados por el gobierno estadounidense. En un comunicado publicado este jueves, el Poder Ejecutivo encabezado por el presidente Santiago Peña señaló que la medida es al amparo de su constitución y expresó: “En atención a ello, la intervención directa o indirecta de cualquier Estado en los asuntos internos del Paraguay compromete la independencia y soberanía de la República. Además de transgredir principios del derecho internacional que rigen las relaciones entre estados con los que el Paraguay se vincula en pie de igualdad”. “Desde el inicio de este gobierno hemos transitado un período en el cual se construyó confianza, por lo que recibimos con desagrado la mediatización y politización de las sanciones administrativas. Por eso, estamos solicitando al gobierno americano acelerar el proceso de salida del embajador, y así evitar que la pérdida de confianza hacia una persona dañe la relación que mantenemos históricamente”, reza la misiva del gobierno paraguayo. “La República del Paraguay tiene una excelente relación con los Estados Unidos y una historia compartida de principios y valores. Como aliados estratégicos colaboramos activamente en temas regionales y globales relacionados a defensa, seguridad, lucha contra la corrupción, comercio e inversiones. Es nuestro firme deseo seguir fortaleciendo y profundizando las fraternas relaciones entre nuestros países”, concluyeron. Pronunciamiento del Gobierno del Paraguay— Vocería de Gobierno del Paraguay (@voceriaparaguay) [pic.twitter.com/aedvMGy7zc] [August 8, 2024] Ostfield comunicó el martes en Asunción la medida que el Tesoro impuso a a Tabacalera del Este (Tabesa) porque supuestamente “ha realizado y planea seguir realizando pagos por valor de millones de dólares a Cartes”, pese a que el exgobernante fue designado como “significativamente corrupto” por EE.UU. en julio de 2022. Tras la sanción, la OFAC incluyó a la empresa, al estar vinculada con Cartes, en la Lista de Nacionales Especialmente Designados y Personas Bloqueadas (SDN, por sus siglas en inglés), lo que obligó al exmandatario a vender sus acciones a la misma la compañía. “Estas acciones de hoy refuerzan las sanciones de Estados Unidos contra el expresidente Cartes y demuestran el compromiso de Estados Unidos de velar por el cumplimiento de las sanciones, impidiendo que personas designadas reciban beneficios materiales en contravención de dichas sanciones”, señaló el embajador. El diplomático añadió que la medida contra Tabesa fue un ejemplo de que Washington “sigue enfocado en garantizar la rendición de cuentas de actores corruptos”. La designación provocó que diputados y senadores del gobernante Partido Colorado emitieran comunicados en respaldo a Cartes, líder de esa agrupación política, y calificaran las sanciones como una “intromisión extranjera”. Con información de EFE

author: @WITN
title: Dustin’s First Alert Forecast: A nice and warm weekend with plenty of sunshine
text: Dustin’s First Alert Forecast: A nice and warm weekend with plenty of sunshine Chillier temperatures next week Sunny skies and seasonable temperatures will kick off the weekend, just in time for Mumfest in New Bern. Highs will top out in the upper 70s on both days, with a light breeze from the southwest from 5-15 mph. Overnight lows will be in the upper 40s & 50s to the upper 50s to lower 60s. As we head into Monday, it will be the last of our warmth to linger around ENC. We could see a stray shower or sprinkle late in the day, but most will be dry, as it is part of a cold front, and this will usher in our first taste of fall-like air. Highs fall to the 60s and overnight lows back in the mid-40s. We will also see northwest breezes sustaining up to 15-20 mph and gusting up to 25-30 mph. Breezes will continue through Wednesday morning before calming down to a sustainable breeze from the north-northeast from 5-10 mph. By Thursday morning, a few areas could see frost to start the morning, as we could wake up in the upper 30s to lower 40s. Sensitive plants will need to be protected or brought indoors. More of the cooler airmass will linger into next weekend. Stay tuned to the latest tropical updates and local town forecasts on the WITN First Alert Weather App. Copyright 2024 WITN. All rights reserved.

author: Kristine Fellizar
title: Tory Burch Is Having One of Its Biggest Sales of the Year With Massive Discounts on Their Iconic Bags, Boots & Miller Cloud Sandals
text:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, SheKnows may receive an affiliate commission.
As the year comes to an end, we can always count on there being countless year-end sales to get us extra excited to start a new year. Whether you’re looking to score some
affordable designer finds or cookware worthy of the likes of Gordon Ramsey and Oprah, you’re sure to find a sale that’ll help you start 2024 off right. If you’re like us and can’t get enough of Tory Burch’s classic and sophisticated styles, you won’t want to miss one of the brand’s biggest sales of the year, which is happening right now.
The
Tory Burch Semi-Annual Sale is back and better than ever before. There are hundreds of pieces of on sale ranging from shopper-loved shoes to their ultra-chic purses. Unlike other sales throughout the year, their Semi-Annual Sale offers discounts on top of discounts. So everything included in their sale section is an extra 25% off. With that additional savings, you can score deals over 50% off. It doesn’t get any better than that.
Naturally, with an additional discount that good, popular styles are already starting to sell out. After all, discounted high-end fashion waits for no one. So, what’s worth shopping now? Take a look below at a
few stylish options that are massively discounted. We guarantee that you’ll want to treat yourself to almost everything!
Our mission at SheKnows is to empower and inspire women, and we only feature products we think you’ll love as much as we do. Please note that if you purchase something by clicking on a link within this story, we may receive a small commission of the sale.
Limited-Edition Crossbody
We’ve had our eye on this super cute find since it dropped ahead of Black Friday. Not only is it a super chic
crossbody bag that you can wear with pretty much anything, it’s limited edition and exclusive to ToryBurch.com. You have six colors to choose from and it’s on sale for nearly 50% off.
Ella Printed Tote Bag
We’re absolutely loving the print on this
Ella Printed Tote Bag, and the tote itself is not bad too! In fact, it’s lightweight, super roomy, and even comes with an interior laptop pocket. You can use it for work or travel. It’s also a great bag if you’re someone who typically likes carrying around everything everywhere.
Minnie Travel Ballet
No other ballet flat is as iconic as
Tory Burch’s Minnie Travel Ballet. They’re super comfortable to wear and go perfectly with jeans, skirts, dresses — you name it. During the brand’s semi-annual sale, you can snag a pair for over 50% off. We recommend acting fast as this popular shoe is selling fast.
Miller Cloud Sandal
Speaking of iconic footwear, it may be winter but there’s no better time to snag a pair of the best-selling
Miller Cloud Sandal. As one reviewer wrote, “These sandals are beautiful and stylish. The fit is excellent and they are super comfortable. The merlot color is divine too.” You can snag these gorgeous merlot sandals with a unique metallic-like finish for nearly 40% off.
Double T Chelsea Boot
Can’t resist a pair of cute Chelsea boots? Neither can we! With Tory Burch’s signature Double T logo elevating these
Chelsea boots, you’re guaranteed to get a ton of compliments. While these boots retail for over $400, you can score them today for just over $180.
Before you go, check out this slideshow below

author: Simran Pasricha
title: Groovin The Moo Cancelled For 2025, Following Splendour's Devastating Footsteps
text:
It seems like the Australian festival scene truly can’t catch a break. Just when we thought things couldn’t get any worse after Splendour In The Grass pulled the plug on this year’s shindig, Groovin The Moo (GTM) has gone and dropped another bombshell.
It’s official, GTM won’t be moo-ving and grooving in 2025.
Another one bites the dust. (Image: Groovin The Moo / Instagram) The organisers broke the news on Instagram this afternoon, leaving loyal fans scratching their heads and wondering what’s next for the beloved regional touring festival . In their post, they said that they’re taking a breather to suss out a more sustainable model for the event.
“Groovin the Moo won’t be happening in 2025, while we work on finding the most sustainable model for Australia’s most loved regional touring festival,” the post read.
“We will really miss seeing the smiling faces of all our beloved Moo Crew – and that means YOU!”
What is going on??? (Image: Groovin The Moo / Instagram) It seems like they’re still keen to revive the music festival as they called for users to give suggestions of artists they’d like to see in a future line up. Either that, or they’re trying to distract us by giving us hope.
This isn’t the first time GTM has hit a rough patch. Last year’s festival got the chop just two weeks after they’d announced their line-up featuring international acts like The Kooks, Melanie C , Jessie Reyez and Stephen Sanchez . They cited insufficient ticket sales as their reason.
The lineup that could have been! (Image: Groovin The Moo / Instagram) GTM has been a staple of the Aussie music scene since 2005, bringing big names like Billie Eilish and Denzel Curry to regional spots across the country.
Although the plight for sustainability is admirable, fans are still disappointed with the news.
One clever cookie suggested, “Just do a year on and year off in conjunction with Splendour or something of similar size. That way, punters have different festivals to look forward too!”
This would be similar to music festivals like Glastonbury that take what is known as a fallow year every four to five years to let the land they use heal and regroup. Aka, I’m hopeful Groovin The Moo will be able to figure something out.
Another loyal fan expressed their sadness, saying, “This makes me sad, hope you can revive the Moo cause she’s a beautiful beast! My daughter & I have attended every year in Bendigo.”
“Sad! We love Groovin as it’s one of the only all ages festivals I can take my kids too,” said another.
With Splendour and now GTM taking a hiatus, it’s clear that the Aussie festival scene is in dire need of help. A girlie just wants to buss down in a field!! Here’s hoping they can find a way to make our dreams come true soon!!

author: VNExplorer
title: Forever Cheer picks Hong Kong as gateway for global launch of pain management drugs with an eye on US$88.2 billion market
text:
Forever Cheer Holding, a biotech company founded by Zhuo Min, a mainland-China-born neuroscientist who teaches at the University of Toronto, has picked Hong Kong as the base for global expansion with an eye on the chronic pain management market. The plan is in sync with the city’s ambition of establishing itself as an international biotech hub.
The global market for such products is projected to grow to US$173.4 billion by 2033 from the current US$88.2 billion, growing at a compound annual growth rate of 7 per cent, according to the New York-based research company Market.us.
“We see the city as the gateway to the international market,” said Ted Chang Zongming, chairman and CEO of Forever Cheer, in an interview with the Post. The company’s goal is to establish a strong presence in China and “connect the city to the global stage as they bring their breakthrough therapies to patients worldwide”, Chang said.
The company, headquartered in Hong Kong since 2015, has offices and production bases in Shanghai, Hangzhou, Qingdao and Ningbo in mainland China.
Its Fujian-born founder Zhuo Min moved to the United States in the 1980s and is now a neuroscience professor at the University of Toronto. The biotech start-up specialises in discovering new therapeutic targets within neuroscience research and developing first-in-class drugs which are prototype drugs that use new, unique ways to treat a particular medical condition.
The company is developing drugs targeting the inhibition of Adenylate Cyclase for both human and animal use. These drugs are currently undergoing various stages of clinical trials and have shown positive results in treating chronic pain without significant side effects or addiction risks, according to Zhuo, who is also the company’s chief scientist.
The pain management market potential was highlighted by pharmaceutical giant Pfizer’s acquisition of Biohaven last year for US$11.6 billion. Pfizer said Biohaven’s migraine drugs could top $6 billion in annual sales at their peak.
In the first half of 2025, the company expects to complete phase two clinical trials of NB001, a drug used to alleviate pain for late stage cancer patients, in China. Before launching the drug for humans, the company will start producing drugs for the treatment of chronic pain in dogs in China next year.
Scientists say the management of chronic pain currently involves opioid analgesics, anticonvulsants, and antidepressants but long-term usage has negative side-effects like diversion and addiction.
Selective adenylyl cyclase type 1 inhibitors could serve as potential alternatives for chronic pain management, Val J Watts, a professor of molecular pharmacology at Purdue University, said in a 2018 article in the Nature Journal.
“The drugs can replace the existing cancer pain analgesics on the market and meet the current huge clinical demand for cancer pain treatment,” said Zhuo.
Preliminary data suggests these drugs are effective, presenting no significant side effects or risk of addiction, he said.
Forever Cheer holds over 10 global patents, covering various fields such as pain management, drug addiction, anxiety, and depression, with patent protection in major countries and regions worldwide. To support its research and development efforts, Forever Cheer has recently established its R&D headquarters in Hong Kong’s Science Park.
